text: Fayette County is a county of the U.S. state of Pennsylvania. Fayette County is located in southwestern Pennsylvania, near Maryland and West Virginia. As of the 2020 census, the population was 128,804. Its county seat is Uniontown. The county was created on September 26, 1783 and named after the Marquis de Lafayette. ==References== Category:1780s establishments in Pennsylvania Category:1783 establishments in the United States Category:Pennsylvania counties
title: Fayette County, Pennsylvania
